padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1831933">reliquary</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-16">10/16/24 02:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Maria from Silent Hill 2 wears this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2317259"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2317259#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2315039" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2315039" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PecanPrincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2281940"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2281940.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PecanPrincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juliette-Has-A-Gun/Miss-Charming-1714.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1714.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Charming"title="Miss Charming"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2315039ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2315039" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2281940">PecanPrincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-13">10/13/24 22:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The cherry here does not work for me at all. I could forgive it as a background note, but obviously here it is meant to be the star. It's a very dim star for me as it falls into the unfortunate cough syrup territory. I will say, though, whenever I've worn this I get tons of compliments! So it is clearly popular for a reason, just not reasons that satisfy me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2315039"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2315039#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2313796" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2313796" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Looongseason"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2181963"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2181963.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Looongseason" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2313796ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2313796" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2181963">Looongseason</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-12">10/12/24 19:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Warm, floral cherry scent in the opening that quickly disappears into something waxy and sweet. Very big compliment getter while the cherry is around. Every stage of this fragrance is beautiful, but the cherry only lasts around 2-3 hours with a minimal sillage and after 4-5 the fragrance will completely disappear. $400 retail and $250 on discounters for a 50ml is LUDICROUS, but the initial scent is admittedly incredible. If it cost a bit less or lasted even a couple hours longer this would be higher. 8.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2313796"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2313796#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2312828" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2312828" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zongo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1559457"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1559457.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zongo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2312828ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2312828" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1559457">Zongo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-11">10/11/24 21:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Holy mother of fruit-scented madness, what kind of olfactory sorcery has Tom Ford conjured up this time? Lost Cherry, they call it. More like "Found Temptation" once you've bathed in this intoxicating elixir.<br />
<br />
Listen up, ladies, because this isn't just a fragrance; it's a goddamn revolution in a bottle. It's the kind of scent that makes you wonder if you've stumbled into an enchanted orchard where the cherries are laced with love potions and the trees whisper dirty secrets.<br />
<br />
The opening salvo? A seductive blast of bitter almond and black cherry, with enough cherry liqueur to make your head spin. It's like being kissed by a gang of cherry-soaked Adonises wielding fruit-flavored lipstick. For a glorious moment, you're the olfactory queen of a hedonistic fruit empire  sweet, tart, and probably illegal in at least three convents.<br />
<br />
But hold onto your panties, you perfume-loving vixens, because this cherry bomb is about to take you on a wild ride. The heart notes saunter in like a band of flirtatious fruit fairies, all sour cherry and plum, with rose and jasmine adding a touch of floral sophistication. It's as if someone decided to throw a lingerie party in the middle of an upscale pastry shop.<br />
<br />
And just when you think you've got a handle on this fruity fantasy, the base notes strut in like a burlesque dancer with a sweet tooth. Vanilla, tonka bean, cinnamon  it's a spice rack orgy that would make a dessert chef blush. Throw in some sandalwood, cedar, and patchouli, and suddenly you're the femme fatale of a film noir set in a luxury bakery.<br />
<br />
Now, let's talk staying power. This scent clings to you like that hot barista's eyes on your dcolletage  intense but not quite long enough. By the time you've finished explaining to your admirers why you smell like sex in a cherry orchard, you might need to reapply. But oh, what a glorious reapplication it is.<br />
<br />
In the end, Lost Cherry is the olfactory embodiment of the modern woman  complex, alluring, and unapologetically bold. It's a scent that purrs, "I'm a fucking goddess, and I smell like your sweetest fantasy." So go ahead, you magnificent temptresses, drench yourselves in this cherry-scented aphrodisiac. Just don't be surprised when you find yourself leading a berry-scented cult of admirers. <br />
<br />
This isn't just a fragrance; it's an invitation to sin, sealed with a cherry kiss.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2312828"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2312828#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2312060" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2312060" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pagecko"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2281479"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2281479.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pagecko" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2312060ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2312060" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2281479">pagecko</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-11">10/11/24 06:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really love this scent. Just not on me. On my car. It reminds me of the smell of the Cherry Jelly Belly Jelly Bean car air freshners I always buy. Like I said, I love this scent. I just think my VW wears it better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2312060"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2312060#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2309463" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2309463" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Colognelover696969"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2280760"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Colognelover696969" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Carolina-Herrera/Bad-Boy-Cobalt-Parfum-Electrique-71888.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71888.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bad Boy Cobalt Parfum Electrique"title="Bad Boy Cobalt Parfum Electrique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2309463ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2309463" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2280760">Colognelover696969</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-08">10/08/24 19:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smells like straight cherry liqueur. Tobacco Vanille would a good mixer for this. Both are good scents for cool to cold nights.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2309463"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2309463#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2308826" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2308826" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KleoCologne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1625707"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1625707.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KleoCologne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Bade-e-Al-Oud-Amethyst-68214.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68214.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bade'e Al Oud Amethyst"title="Bade'e Al Oud Amethyst"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2308826ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2308826" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1625707">KleoCologne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-08">10/08/24 08:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lost Cherry is a decadent delight, very cherry forward, but not a synthetic candy-like cherry. The cherry notes of Lost Cherry are very accurate to the real thing, with some light floral notes to tie it together, a bit of warmth. <br />
<br />
Overall, I'm a huge fan of this fragrance. It's unlike most fragrances you'd smell out in the wild, so it can be a bit of a head turner. I work as a mechanic by day, so naturally I had to test the longevity of this fragrance. Turns out, it lasts around 6 - 8 hours for me, which is just fine, but I've recieved multiple compliments from coworkers in that time. If you're worried about a synthetic cherry note and you're curious if this is worth the risk, I say pull the trigger and get yourself a bottle anyway.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2308826"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2308826#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2306080" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This is SO special and delicious. Definitely for<br />
more formal and or evenings out but I LOVE this stuff.  Tom<br />
Ford fragrances are over priced but there are amazing dupes from Dossier</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2293107"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2293107#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2292550" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2292550" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="roachbait"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1766714"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="roachbait" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2292550ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2292550" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1766714">roachbait</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-23">09/23/24 10:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>FFO: amaretto, using baby lotion as an adult, nurse motifs, kuudere anime characters</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2292550"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2292550#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2289644" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2289644" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="semyonsemyoff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2087624"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2087624.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="semyonsemyoff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hugo-Boss/Boss-Bottled-383.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.383.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Boss Bottled"title="Boss Bottled"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2289644ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2289644" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2087624">semyonsemyoff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-20">09/20/24 13:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not much you can say that hasn't been said. I adhere to the cherry fanboys. My wife certified that it's too feminine for a man. But I can't resist it. They say Cherry Smoke is more manly and Electric Cherry is even more feminine. Haven't tried neither yet, but I will. Personally, I can't see how anyone can wholeheartedly dislike it, at least not on oneself, but smelling it on someone else.<br />
I like to ask one question - is it memorable? If it is, even if you may dislike it, you have to admit that it's something of an achievement for a perfumer. How does one make something memorable? And mind you, a smell is thing you may confidently remember for life. This is worth something.<br />
This Lost Cherry can be a finding for many people, especially those that have the most vague idea of what a perfume is (and there are great many people like this) and that it can actually smell like a beautiful sweet liquor jam cherry.<br />
<br />
Tom Ford - Found Cherry</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2289644"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2289644#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2288940" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2288940" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SLSAMG_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1533693"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1533693.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SLSAMG_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silver Mountain Water"title="Silver Mountain Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2288940ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2288940" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1533693">SLSAMG_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-20">09/20/24 00:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What can I say without offending TF fanboys... It's nausea-inducing and overly sweet to the point it's offensive to everyone that comes in close proximity to the wearer. Thank God for it's weak projection. If you want to smell like your local supermarket's cherry cake, go for it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2288940"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2288940#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2287922" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2287922" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="naylonumsu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2252506"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="naylonumsu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2287922ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2287922" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2287317" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Alpearl72"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1751997"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Alpearl72" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2287317ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2287317" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1751997">Alpearl72</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-18">09/18/24 15:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lost Cherry is an amazing scent with the perfect blend of cherry and bitter almond. It can be worn by both women and men but it leans to feminine side a bit more. Its real magic is that it can be layered with so many fragrances to add them a more unisex appeal. IMO the best combo is when it is layered with Killian's Angels' Share. If you have them both, just give it a try. Trust me the experience is going to be out of this world...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2287317"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2287317#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2285640" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2285640" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DopamineHunter"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2223378"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2223378.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="DopamineHunter" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Mod-Vanilla-77799.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.77799.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mod Vanilla"title="Mod Vanilla"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2285640ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2285640" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2223378">DopamineHunter</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-17">09/17/24 05:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The bitter almond is so damn prominent in this scent! Which is exactly what I was looking for since I am a sucker for bitter almond.<br />
<br />
One would expect a cherry scent to be too sweet and juvenile and immature to a fault, but that's not the case with this scent. This perfume not only is very bitter almond-esque as mentioned, but it also has this deep, juicy cherry scent that is in no way medicinal, but also not natural. It's hard to explain. It's like a deep, boozy cherry cocktail, not just cherry liquor in itself. There is indeed a detectable floral in the background, but it's overpowered by the cherries and bitter almond in the initial spray. I can definitely see why people are so in love with this scent, it's just so sexy and deep, it can keep everyone going.<br />
<br />
Definitely a scent that's too heavy to be worn in warmer months and although it's a unisex scent, I do believe this is more feminine leaning. I don't see a lot of men that are fans of cherries on themselves of course. It's rather the opposite, I've asked a majority of my men friends and they stated that they do indeed enjoy a boozy scent like this one on a woman.<br />
<br />
Me personally I haven't worn this just yet, but I am very damn familiar with the scent. It's an aphrodisiac for sure. This WILL get you compliments, just trust me. <br />
<br />
(SIDE NOTE: I saw someone saying that this smells just the same as Dr Pepper tastes and I kinda have to agree to a degree- While it isn't a fully accurate description of how this smells as it's way more deep and complicated than a fizzy drink, I do have to agree that this does smell like Cherry Cola to a degree. Such a funny comparison! XD)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2285640"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2285640#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2285043" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2285043" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="candi_n_spice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1491103"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1491103.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="candi_n_spice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Estee-Lauder/Modern-Muse-Le-Rouge-Gloss-38990.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38990.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Modern Muse Le Rouge Gloss"title="Modern Muse Le Rouge Gloss"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2285043ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2285043" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1491103">candi_n_spice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-16">09/16/24 15:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I did not expect that heavy jasmine opening! Much more floral than I was imagining. Definitely leans more feminine than I expected. Not a bad thing, just unexpected. I wasn't super into it at first, but then I witnessed it develop in front of my nose, fruity notes popping up, a little spice, a little patchouli. I do like it. My favorite cherry remains Estee Lauder Modern Muse Le Rouge Gloss, but it's a very different frag. I like jasmine, but it's not my favorite, can be a little soapy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2285043"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2285043#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2282824" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2282824" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KatzisNase"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2253916"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2253916.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KatzisNase" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zadig-Voltaire/This-is-Her-39358.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39358.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="This is Her"title="This is Her"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2282824ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2282824" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2253916">KatzisNase</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-14">09/14/24 13:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was an accidental trend setter in my friend group. Its very flirty and spicy. I would wesr this in autumn and summer.It is very dark feminine to me. The price however is very high and it doesnt perform well. I will try finding a good dupe because I do love the cherry liquor scent that it has. In four words Lost cherry is sexy,confident,spicy,feminine</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2282824"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2282824#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2278177" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2278177" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maxmiller614"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2192051"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2192051.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maxmiller614" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2278177ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2278177" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2192051">Maxmiller614</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-10">09/10/24 11:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lost Cherry kind of gets lost in the mix when it comes to TF frags. I wore this probably 5/6 times from the private label discovery set, and I personally felt it was very synthetic, and almost candy like. It is unisex leaning feminine, and the longevity isn't great. Probably 4 hours. <br />
<br />
The pros are that you really wont come across this fragrance much out and about. But the unfortunate thing is that Lost Cherry isn't my favorite, and I'm not sure I would recommend it to anyone. The cherry note is blended very sweet and vanilla like, which makes it a challenging wear in my opinion, and if you're teetering on gourmand territory there are soooo many better options.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2278177"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2278177#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2277478" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2277478" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KRock4x4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2191618"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2191618.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KRock4x4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Absolu-Aventus-84112.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84112.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Absolu Aventus"title="Absolu Aventus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2277478ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2277478" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2191618">KRock4x4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-09">09/09/24 19:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tom Ford sold out long ago.  Reducing oils and longevity for profits by his buy out from Estee Lauder.   Be smart. Research and buy dupes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2277478"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2277478#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2276777" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2276777" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="brainbomb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1570402"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1570402.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="brainbomb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Opium-Eau-de-Parfum-2009-7399.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7399.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Opium Eau de Parfum 2009"title="Opium Eau de Parfum 2009"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2276777ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2276777" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1570402">brainbomb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-09">09/09/24 06:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wouldn't say this fragrance is groundbreaking and it is slightly overhyped. If you want to the full cherry experience try the superior Cherry Smoke or Kayali Lovefest Cherry. To me, the almond in this overpowers the cherry and I don't get the "cough syrup" scent at all *in fact* I want MORE of that syrupy cherry goodness. For the longevity, it's quite disappointing since it lasts 1-2 hours on my skin. It projects just well in the first hour though. <br />
<br />
Overall a decent fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2276777"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2276777#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2276568" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I kind of like it, but it's not worth the money.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2276568"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2276568#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2274777" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2274325" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rylai"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/67827"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.67827.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="rylai" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Ange-ou-Demon-701.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.701.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ange ou Demon"title="Ange ou Demon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2274325ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2274325" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/67827">rylai</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-07">09/07/24 01:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The elegant cherry opening gives way to an almond, honeyed woody note towards the end. Oddly enough, the finish is a bit like Kilian's Can't Stop Loving You, but I'm not sure, probably the vetiver note makes me think about it. It is a very gourmand and generally successful fragrance, but the longevity is almost nil.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2274325"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2274325#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2270698" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2268231" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emmascents96"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2239177"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="emmascents96" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2268231ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2268231" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2239177">emmascents96</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-01">09/01/24 11:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have no longevity issues as others do, but this smell is powdery on me (one of my least favorite scent profiles). I get compliments on this scent frequently, and I do love the cherry scent, but personally I would prefer a fragrance that leans less powdery.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2268231"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2268231#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2267494" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2267494" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LadyEmilyJones"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1801609"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1801609.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LadyEmilyJones" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2267494ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2267494" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1801609">LadyEmilyJones</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-31">08/31/24 17:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An absolutely iconic scent, one that certainly influenced the trend of cherry fragrances into the mainstream. The notes are beautiful and compliment each other well, although the cherry does die down in favour of almond and vanilla once dried. For the ludicrous price, you would hope for better lasting and sillage, but overall not bad.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2267494"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2267494#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2266553" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2266553" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scrumptious Nut"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219683"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scrumptious Nut" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2266553ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2266553" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219683">Scrumptious Nut</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-30">08/30/24 22:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Incredible scent, incredible price.<br />
<br />
Going on the hunt for a well reviewed clone I think.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2266553"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2266553#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2266267" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2266267" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="canadianpetite"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/229716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="canadianpetite" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/By-the-Fireplace-31623.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31623.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="By the Fireplace"title="By the Fireplace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2266267ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2266267" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/229716">canadianpetite</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-30">08/30/24 16:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The first minute is all about a bright cherry with some cough syrup. Five minutes in, almonds and vanilla join in. If I close my eyes, I can detect hints of cinnamon. Ten minutes in, the almond takes charge amongst balsam &amp; sandalwood. Woods now dominate until it fades away. Where did the cherry go? Ahhhh, Lost Cherry - I get it. <br />
<br />
One spray on me:<br />
Sillage: arm's length<br />
Longevity: about 2 hours then detectable only on a hug<br />
Rating: 2/5 need more florals but 4/5 as male scent</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2266267"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2266267#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2264535" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
On the more expensive side though, as all TF fragrances are, its a good pick for special occasions.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2264535"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2264535#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2259452" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2259452" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="poettcp"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128112"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2128112.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="poettcp" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Bitter-Peach-62707.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62707.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bitter Peach"title="Bitter Peach"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2259452ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2259452" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128112">poettcp</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-24">08/24/24 08:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the best cherry perfumes out there. Every note is so potent: the almont, the cherries, the plum, it's actually mindblowing. It has the perfect amount of depth too. I kinda wish it had more sillage, but it lasts quite good on me.<br />
Way too overpriced tho... I agree that this is a wonderful perfume but 600 for the 100ml bottle is hysterical. (get the dupes if you can hehe)<br />
<br />
If this has too much depth for you, and you want a more vibrant cherry smell for affordable price, I recommend the Cherry Blossom perfume from Monotheme Venezia.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2251812" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ch3rrybaby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2224007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2224007.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ch3rrybaby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2251812ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2251812" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2224007">ch3rrybaby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-16">08/16/24 21:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This would be my favorite perfume ever if it lasted longer. It must be called Lost Cherry because you lose the cherry within a few short hours. The dry down is more boring to me as the cherry fades away. It actually makes me so sad. For the price it is ridiculous how short it lasts on my skin. Otherwise, I'm very much obsessed. It's definitely in the top two cherry scents for me along with Black Opium's cherry scent. Veryyyy sexy, mysterious, and chic vibe. Perfect for a night out or a cold day. Alcohol-y but not in a bad way, and not medicinal at all. Ughhh wish I could find a way to make it last</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2251812"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2251812#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2250596" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
