This and Cherry Smoke. The only one that I absolutely love is Electric Cherry, now that's a fantastic cherry scent!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2250596"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2250596#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2248356" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2248356" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mazkmac"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2221098"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2221098.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mazkmac" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2248356ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2248356" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2221098">mazkmac</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-13">08/13/24 17:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My first ever signature scent - I have owned about four of the 10ml bottles so far. And my first ever review! <br />
<br />
This is the most realistic and most .. well-rounded cherry Ive ever smelt. Its youthful and somewhat unique, but not complex enough to call intriguing. My take on this perfume is nothing that hasnt been said before. The opening for me is fresh and seductive, almost like an alcoholic Shirley Temple with a dash too much grenadine. This scent doesnt evolve much for me, and it remains very much syrupy, sweet cherry the entire time. I can detect a whisper of what smells to me like miscellaneous florals as the dry down begins. By the end of its silage (so approximately 15 minutes later ) its a softer, but still jammy black cherry with a subdued background of almond and spiced vanilla. <br />
<br />
Unfortunately, my skin devours most perfumes, and the already weak longevity on this one didnt stand a chance. On a good day this will stay on my skin for about an hour, a little less on clothing. This is what has held me back from a full size version everytime. If youre going to a doctors appointment and want to smell like a bucket of maraschino cherries, the longevity and scent is perfect. Any event longer than that and youre out of luck.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2248356"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2248356#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2244469" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2244469" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Atui"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2158401"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Atui" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2244469ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2244469" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2158401">Atui</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-09">08/09/24 21:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely despise this scent, almost makes me gag, it smells like a cherry medicine... ew</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2244469"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2244469#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2241088" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2241088" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FragranceMaestro"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1990086"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1990086.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FragranceMaestro" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Homme-Ideal-Eau-de-Parfum-37735.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37735.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="LHomme Ideal Eau de Parfum"title="LHomme Ideal Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2241088ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2241088" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1990086">FragranceMaestro</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-06">08/06/24 16:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like a cherry pie, love it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2241088"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2241088#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2240017" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2240017" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wintersong0"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1894011"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1894011.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wintersong0" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2240017ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2240017" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1894011">wintersong0</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-05">08/05/24 17:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't normally wear gourmands or super fruity fragrances in my personal wardrobe, although they're fun and definitely a mood-booster. I also have *strong* feelings about TF's pricing. I never had a serious interest in trying this but I got a sample and started casually sniffing around my collection and I felt a pull for it. I gave it a good solid wear and discovered I LOVE THIS. <br />
<br />
I love Lost Cherry specifically because the cherry isn't center stage the whole wear. What has me is the drydown, which I love for the fact it's not overly fruity or gourmand. I get only whispers of cherry booziness amongst a blend of notes that's out of this world. The drydown is one of those blends that bring ME joy above all else, and therefore I must have exactly that scent somehow and I can't be satisfied with anything less. Honestly...the longevity was better than I expected too. It would be so much easier if longevity was as bad as I anticipated or I liked it for the compliments or the occasion it would suit but no...this is something specific that I love just because I do. I've been looking everywhere for a dupe that captures the drydown but nothing has it quite right. Many dupes are created to address the most common complaints of the cherry not lasting etc. <br />
<br />
I've gotten myself into quite a situation. I've been wading through a sea of dupes and counterfeit listings and I have a sneaking suspicion that only the OG is gonna fill the need. But with that infuriatingly high price point I might just be destined to suffer without.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2240017"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2240017#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2236128" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2236128" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eva.daisy.88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1401688"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1401688.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eva.daisy.88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Pacific-Chill-81423.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81423.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pacific Chill"title="Pacific Chill"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2236128ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2236128" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1401688">eva.daisy.88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-01">08/01/24 17:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This should be renamed to Maraschino cherry. <br />
If you ever had a cocktail decorated with those chemically bright red, sugar-saturated cherries, with their stones liquified - this smells exactly like these cherries. <br />
When the initial top notes disappear and the perfume starts to develop more, the bitter almond with vanilla and tonka bean kind of suffocate the initial juiciness and make this too cloying for my liking. It turns into a very sensual scent, not a bright cherry scent anymore. Also the fragrance lasts maybe 2 hours - best - kind of waste of money.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2236128"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2236128#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2229346" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2229346" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="readyfuels"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1736361"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1736361.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="readyfuels" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Akro/Dark-51706.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51706.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dark"title="Dark"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2229346ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2229346" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1736361">readyfuels</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-25">07/25/24 14:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i actually bought dossier's ambery cherry before buying a travel size of lost cherry, because i had heard it was a good dupe and thought if i liked the dossier then i would definitely like the tf. weirdly... i prefer the dossier?? they have a nearly identical opening, but the dry down on lost cherry is heavier than in ambery cherry - likely the patchouli? longevity also was much shorter on me - a couple hours or so.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2229346"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2229346#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2228948" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2228948" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="catsgosalsa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2203798"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2203798.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="catsgosalsa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2228948ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2228948" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2203798">catsgosalsa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-25">07/25/24 07:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>very pleasant as it settles down, but the initial notes smell like those bright red jarred cherries that people put on their cocktails - cheap and kind of sickly. didn't last long on my skin at all, maybe like 30 mins before it wore off. not bad but the price is a little crazy for how quickly it fades</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2228948"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2228948#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2228468" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2228468" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Beccascent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2190188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2190188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Beccascent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2228468ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2228468" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2190188">Beccascent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-24">07/24/24 17:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really get the black cherry, cherry liquor, and cloves. Its sexy and dark. Ive received compliments while wearing this. It makes a killer pairing with BR540 extrait. Thats the only time I even wear the latter anymore, since its so popular. Anyway, lost cherry doesnt last long, sadly. However, I still love it for the fall and winter and dont mind reapplying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2228468"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2228468#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2225976" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2225976" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="venussiandehermes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2107198"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2107198.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="venussiandehermes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/XJ-1861-Naxos-30529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="XJ 1861 Naxos"title="XJ 1861 Naxos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2225976ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2225976" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2107198">venussiandehermes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-22">07/22/24 08:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A photorealistic alcoholic cherry scent. It is a very good and useful fragrance for me. It is far from being among my favorite colognes, but if you still like to collect it, I think it will be an interesting alternative to have in your collection. If your priority expectation from a fragrance is performance, I recommend you stay away from this. Because it is quite expensive considering its low performance.<br />
<br />
I'm not a fan of the opening of the scent.  However, I really liked the sweet cherry style of its drying. It takes about 2-3 hours after applying the perfume for this perfume to become what I like.<br />
<br />
Still, I think the middle and bottom notes of this scent blend very well with the cherry and alcohol background. It smells of quality, but it still doesn't fully reflect my style. If you want to use a more masculine cherry note, you can choose Cherry Smoke. I think it is ideal for those who like unisex scents with a high feminine tendency.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2225976"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2225976#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2225411" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2225411" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Oxana123456789"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1836514"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1836514.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Oxana123456789" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Under-The-Lemon-Tree-53379.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53379.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Under The Lemon Tree"title="Under The Lemon Tree"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2225411ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2225411" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1836514">Oxana123456789</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-21">07/21/24 13:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is a very beautiful bottle. Scent is cherry. It is juicy, rich, sweet cherry. It lasts for about 2 minutes. Way overpriced.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2225411"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2225411#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2224635" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2224635" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="venusinyourfurs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2040127"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2040127.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="venusinyourfurs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Attar-Collection/Musk-Kashmir-38134.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38134.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Musk Kashmir"title="Musk Kashmir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2224635ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2224635" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2040127">venusinyourfurs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-20">07/20/24 15:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I understand why many people dislike this scent; cherry fragrances are often poorly executed, and I have my own reservations about Tom Ford as well. However, theres something undeniably addicting about this fragrance ? It radiates a sensuality that makes your mind feel hazy and muddled, as if youre intoxicated by cherry liqueur. The scent truly shines once it has completely dried down after a few hours, leaving you with the spirit of the most fleshiest roses and a delightfully sour undertone. It makes me feel dangerously alluring. Although its not everyones preference, I love it. For those looking for a similar scent, Finery offers a great dupe with a spicier twist.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2224635"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2224635#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2223896" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2216907" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dudegetsmoney"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2071768"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2071768.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dudegetsmoney" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Afternoon-Swim-53947.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53947.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Afternoon Swim "title="Afternoon Swim "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2216907ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2216907" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); Not worth the money. Maybe a unique scent worn on a person, but the fragrance scent itself is not at all unique.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2216907"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2216907#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2213051" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2213051" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="goldfever"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2166780"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="goldfever" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Jacobs/Daisy-Dream-25289.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25289.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Daisy Dream"title="Daisy Dream"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2213051ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2213051" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2166780">goldfever</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-09">07/09/24 10:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>RIP my wallet because I LOVE this. It smells like a cocktail or if cough syrup was sexy. This strikes the right balance between complex and simple: not so complex you have no idea what you're smelling but not so simple it's boring. My only complaints are it comes on a little strong, doesn't last as long as it could, and of course, the price point. It starts strong with the cherry, then you get the almond, and the woody dry down. It's just fantastic, I think this will have near-universal appeal. I recommend it for my fellow non-binary peeps because it's truly unisex imo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2213051"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2213051#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2212582" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2212582" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bonzuo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2029907"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="bonzuo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2212582ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2212582" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2029907">bonzuo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-08">07/08/24 23:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smells like cherry cough syrup. Upon opening I literally gagged LOL, sprayed it on my boyfriend's arm otherwise I would've scrubbed it off. I smelt a whiff of the drydown a few hours later and the cherry smell pushes back into something sweeter yet still SO COUGH SYRUPY. I can't do it - cherry hater</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2212582"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2212582#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2204720" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2204720" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dodo777"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1472793"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1472793.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dodo777" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2204720ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2204720" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1472793">dodo777</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-01">07/01/24 08:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The most amazing thing you'll ever smell for a duration of 30 minutes to an hour tops. Sigh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2204720"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2204720#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2204272" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2204272" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="crushedmarigolds"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1383800"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1383800.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="crushedmarigolds" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2204272ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2204272" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1383800">crushedmarigolds</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-30">06/30/24 17:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>to celebrate the start of summer, on this warm rainy night i am wearing lost cherry to bed. i dont know why, but this is my favorite fragrance to wear to sleep. there is something so deliciously... - i wanted to say gothic, but that wouldn't be right - about it. for some reason, every time i smell this fragrance i think of the very bad movie 'sucker punch' from 2011. im not sure why. or perhaps the 'mr brightside' music video. or moulin rouge. lost cherry is as girly and sweet as it is decadent and eerie. delightfully rich and syrupy, boozy and sticky. this fragrance is playful, innocent, and undeniably lewd, all at once. i dont wear this perfume often, partially because i have only a few sprays of it left from my decant, and partially because it is best savoured and worn only if you're in the right mood for it, as it can be quite cloying and overwhelming if worn in too hot weather. this is cough syrup and cherry lollipops, in the best way possible.<br />
<br />
post scriptum: i sprayed this twice on my neck at 3am and it is now 2pm and i can still very much smell it! good longevity, if you ask me</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2204272"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2204272#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2203928" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2203928" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="starielord"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2161017"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2161017.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="starielord" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2203928ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2203928" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2161017">starielord</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-30">06/30/24 10:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't know what's the deal with Lost Cherry but it mersmerized my boyfriend the second he smelled it and he just simply said "we are buying this".  I have used it for 2 months and then i somehow lost it and did not repurchase. I think it smells very sexy but in the opening, boozy cherry is too prominent and sharp, after it dries down, the rose, vanilla and plum comes forward and creates a much better, creamy, feminine, sexy and interesting smell. It was the first parfume that made me realize that there is much more about fragrances beyond smelling like flowers.<br />
<br />
Edit: he tried it after a year and didn't like it, suggests that Cherry Smoothie is better :p</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2203928"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2203928#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2202094" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2202094" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="oliwiakuchar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2176531"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2176531.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="oliwiakuchar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/Vanilla-Candy-Rock-Sugar-42-92258.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.92258.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Candy Rock Sugar | 42"title="Vanilla Candy Rock Sugar | 42"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2202094ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2202094" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2176531">oliwiakuchar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-28">06/28/24 10:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Frickin overpriced cherry vodka, that turns into spiced and stale honey (If honey could ever go stale). I dont get how people are so in love with this fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2202094"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2202094#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2200335" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2200335" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NorthBlue"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2133764"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2133764.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="NorthBlue" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2200335ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2200335" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2133764">NorthBlue</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-26">06/26/24 14:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My vagina soaks whenever I smell this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2200335"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2200335#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2199876" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2199876" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="evavidal62"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1917831"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="evavidal62" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Coco-Eau-de-Parfum-609.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.609.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coco Eau de Parfum"title="Coco Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2199876ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2199876" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1917831">evavidal62</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-26">06/26/24 05:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I found myself liking this fragrance but not thrilled about it. Even so, there's a cuteness and youthfulness to it that appeals to me. This is a cute but not particularly special gourmand. It is popular and mainstream. Cherry is the theme. All the notes in it go back to cherry. Opens with the black cherry, plum, cherry liqueur, and sour cherry. The effect it gives off is that of a cherry coca cola. It is sweet and fizzy, effervescent, mood lifting, bright and happy, youthful. I am back to being 13 or 14 in junior high smelling of sweet body sprays. This is a pretty feminine cherry. The vanilla is non-existent to my nose. The base notes that stand out as it dries (in it's short life) include the balsamic accords i.e. peru balsam, the cloves and the vetiver. The cinnamon I wish was stronger. This is not a true gourmand because any other gourmand notes would be able to stand out. I wanted it to have more character. More vanilla, more plum, some additional gourmand note. This was also an attempt to merge jasmine sambac with cherry but the cherry kicks its ass. I don't smell any rose. I wish this was a cherry going into floral going into gourmand and balsam or amber. But it's boring, cheap smelling, and like a Bath and Body Works fragrance that you can buy at any shopping mall. This is overpriced for it's cheapness. I wish Tom Ford could put it's act together. There are only a few TF perfumes that are actually good. In my personal opinion, Jasmine Rouge, Noir de Noir, Cafe Rose, Rose Prick, Rose D'Amalfi, Neroli Portofino are extraordinary. I wanted to like this but it could have been better. For those that do like it, this is just a casual for hanging out with friends night out kind of vibe, night club night for dancing, or just smelling sweet and nice but not a statement maker. It is just cheap cherry coke for teens and 18-20 year olds who don't know much about perfume and just wear something popular and gourmand. No offense.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2199876"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2199876#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2199553" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2199553" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lamzyarlan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1167419"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1167419.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lamzyarlan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/MYSLF-Le-Parfum-94983.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.94983.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="MYSLF Le Parfum"title="MYSLF Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2199553ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2199553" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1167419">lamzyarlan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-25">06/25/24 19:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you know anything about good perfumes, then this is one of them, period.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2199553"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2199553#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2199032" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2199032" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Whiff_Of_Brilliance101"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2126503"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Whiff_Of_Brilliance101" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2199032ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2199032" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2126503">Whiff_Of_Brilliance101</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-25">06/25/24 07:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First time I smelled this fragrance was when I was interested in buying the cherry gift set which includes  10ml of lost cherry, cherry smoke and electric cherry. <br />
<br />
Lost cherry smells amazing on my skin compared to the testing paper. In the first ten minutes the top notes come out which is absolutely beautiful and has a strong projectivity however thirty minutes after, it became a skin scent. <br />
<br />
I did end up buying the cherry gift set because i wanted to try electric cherry and cherry smoke as well. <br />
<br />
I decided to experiment a bit with my body care routine to see if it would make lost cherry last longer. I bought a cherry scented shower gel + body lotion and over sprayed ( pulse points + hair ) and it lasted 6+ hours on skin and I could still smell it on my hair when I went to bed! <br />
<br />
When I finish the 10ml sample from the gift set,  I will purchase the 30ml! Lost cherry is not a summer fragrance because it feels heavy  however I can see myself wearing this a lot in autumn and winter.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2199032"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2199032#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2198850" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; At first I got cough medicine vibes but after it settles its actually gorgeous, it smells like a cherry almond danish almost its dark and sweet and intoxicating. I want to try the other Tom ford cherries now!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2198850"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2198850#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2196765" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2196765" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="slow_burn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1856996"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1856996.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="slow_burn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clive-Christian/Blonde-Amber-73595.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73595.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blonde Amber"title="Blonde Amber"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2196765ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2196765" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1856996">slow_burn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-22">06/22/24 21:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My son has this and one evening I hugged him when I got home from work and he smelled wonderful. I asked "are you wearing Lost Cherry?"  He was and told me he'd sprayed it on 12 hours earlier.<br />
<br />
The reviewers claiming it smells synthetic or like cough syrup must've been sold counterfeits, because real Lost Cherry by Tom Ford smells like fresh, ripe cherries with gentle hints of sandalwood, vanilla and patchouli.<br />
<br />
In my opinion this is better for people under 35. It's a unisex fragrance that really smells great on both men and women.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2196765"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2196765#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2195107" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2185732" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bnknowsfrag"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2132381"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2132381.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bnknowsfrag" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2185732ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2185732" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2132381">Bnknowsfrag</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-12">06/12/24 04:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tom ford lost cherry is a really good fragrance and it is one of those ones which smell really good and has decent performance but the price just lets me down and really disappointed me. Lost cherry is a really edible smelling scent with a really sweet cherry opening which smells unbelievable and then it dries down to a more gourmand nutty scent which is also divine. I love this because of its unique scent profile and its edible smell. The performance is kind of lacklustre for the 220 youre paying and the price really annoys me. Overall this is a very high quality cherry scent and it is best during winter.<br />
<br />
Smell 9.6/10<br />
Sillage 7/10<br />
Longevity 7/10<br />
Bottle 8.4/10<br />
How much I would pay for it. 50ml: 150</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2185732"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2185732#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2184466" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2184466" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cmh9217"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343938"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1343938.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cmh9217" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Infusion-d-Iris-1795.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1795.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Infusion d'Iris"title="Infusion d'Iris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2184466ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2184466" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343938">cmh9217</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-10">06/10/24 20:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is one of my absolute favorites, and this post isnt exactly a review for this frag, but more of an FYI for this frags lovers.<br />
<br />
Imagine my surprise when I sauntered on into the local BBW to pick up my online order this evening and happened to come across their Sweetheart Cherry fragrance mist (which has not yet made it into the database here yet). BBW Sweetheart Cherry is as close to a cheap Dupe as you can get to TF Lost Cherry, BUT, and there most certainly is a BUT, BBW has added in what I refer to as Eau de Dirt. My nose tells me that this has something to do with the pistachio in the Sweetheart Cherry notes. That aside, if you LOVE Lost Cherry, you may want to check out Sweetheart Cherry lotion to layer with your Lost Cherry.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2184466"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2184466#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2179589" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2179589" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="asimpleperfumelover"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236779"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1236779.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="asimpleperfumelover" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2179589ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2179589" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236779">asimpleperfumelover</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-05">06/05/24 23:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Straight-up cherry syrup. The bitter almond note makes it seem like the cherries were added completely with their pits. Again, the dry-down has this common DNA (benzoin and tonka) which I'm not too fond of. Too overhyped for what it is.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2179589"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2179589#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2179176" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2179176" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="babyflesh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2153287"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="babyflesh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fantome/Vassago-83604.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83604.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vassago"title="Vassago"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2179176ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2179176" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2153287">babyflesh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-05">06/05/24 14:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was honestly shocked by how much I hated this scent. I kept smelling myself again and again to double check that it still smelled bad, because I would've expected such an expensive and mainstream perfume to at least be moderately pleasing to smell, even if it wasn't my personal taste. I'm not normally immune to the allure of super popular fragrances, so I didn't expect to be so grossed out by it. There's not much depth to this smell; it's hard to pick out any particular notes and just smells like one single bad scent. I guess it smells...cherry adjacent? But not in an enjoyable way. I'm admittedly happy I didn't like it because of how absurdly overpriced it is.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2179176"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2179176#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2179025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
