This fragrance is insane smelt this at the mall and was just blown away it says its a women fragrance but I think a man could pull this off for some occasions. Its smell is cherry and sort of vannila flavour which is really nice. The only thing is with this fragrance that really brings it down is the price which is about 300 pounds for it which is way too much. Because I smelt this at the store I can not know the longevity but I can make an estimate from the votes so for ratings. <br />
<br />
Silliage 7.5/10<br />
Longevity 7/10<br />
Scent 9.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2176405"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2176405#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2175660" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2175660" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bingo30"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1851398"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1851398.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bingo30" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2175660ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2175660" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); <br />
Unfortunately the cherry leans too feminine sweet for me but I recommend this one for the ladies<br />
<br />
5.9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2175660"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2175660#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2175154" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2175154" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vminie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128906"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vminie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2175154ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2175154" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128906">vminie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-01">06/01/24 21:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A mellow cherry liqueur or syrup. Reminds me of a cherry cola without the fizz. A cool sugared gelatin (or licorice) kind of scent that's not cloying nor synthetically sweet. I can definitely sense the cinnamon in there. Not my first choice of a perfume but since I was given this, I tried it on and something about it was quite addicting. I was worried at first that it will smell too strongly of cherries aka cough syrup vibes. But, it's just subtle, classy, gorgeous, and very different. Maybe it's the almost creamy sugared cherries with a hint of cinnamon in it. Not too gourmand that it will offend those who are not into gourmand scents. My only beef with this is how absurdly expensive this is. It has lasting power, tried spraying it on my skin and on paper. Left it overnight and the next day, the paper spray test smelled insanely good. On my skin, it didn't last as long but then I just tested it on my wrists. Will try to go out using this and test it out on normal errands-filled days</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2175154"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2175154#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2175017" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2175017" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TheScentsei"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2152718"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2152718.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TheScentsei" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2175017ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2175017" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2152718">TheScentsei</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-01">06/01/24 18:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very feminine, super cloying, and overpriced. That's all</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2175017"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2175017#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2174554" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Well done, Tom Ford. Longevity is incredible- 10+ hours.sillage and projection are on point. Great performance all the way around. Opens as a blast of pure fresh cherries, and the drydown is heavenly- vanilla with dark cherry, plum, tonka beans, and a slight hint of sandalwood and florals. Truly, a masterpiece.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2169800"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2169800#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2168863" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It actually shocks me every time that it opens so grandly, then falls flat so quickly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2164526"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2164526#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2164349" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2163190" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ilovesarcasticbrunettes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1840801"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1840801.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ilovesarcasticbrunettes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2163190ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2163190" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1840801">ilovesarcasticbrunettes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-21">05/21/24 10:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>You got ill. You went to the hospital and the doctor charged you a hefty fee for a bottle of gooey cough syrup. Before you could speak a word they shoved a spoonful right down your throat without telling you. They seem to do this very often, as they offered a sweet treat for psychological damage compensation right afterwards, which unsurprisingly was a cheap artificial cherry lollipop from the dollar store. You recovered at once after you took the medicine, and the taste only lingered for a few minutes. Somehow you cant tell if its a good thing or not.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2163190"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2163190#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2161872" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2161872" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TheFraganist55"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2029669"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2029669.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="TheFraganist55" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2161872ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2161872" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2029669">TheFraganist55</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-20">05/20/24 07:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Considering this fragrance is as simple as deciding whether or not you enjoy the smell of cherries. Because it smells like cherries, what a surprise.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2161872"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2161872#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2161407" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2161407" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="beautynerd"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/608077"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.608077.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="beautynerd" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2161407ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2161407" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/608077">beautynerd</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-19">05/19/24 18:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I always wanted to smell like cherry coke. I finally found the scent that gives me the pleasure of smelling like my favorite soda drink. Its not childish or cloying- which is what I expected- but, what I got was a soft sparkling realistic cherry note,  dusted with a lovely sandalwood, tonka bean and bitter almond, and smoothly blended with florals and spices. What a perfect scent for someone who loves gourmands and can pull off the vibe of  pretty, sexy and cute all at once.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2161407"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2161407#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2160440" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Really disappointed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2154318"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2154318#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2154110" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2154110" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosierpunk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1993365"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1993365.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosierpunk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2154110ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2154110" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1993365">rosierpunk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-12">05/12/24 21:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bitter almond, cherry syrup, and tonka bean.<br />
<br />
Initially, it is a blast of cherry pie followed by bitter almond and nutty notes, along with tonka bean and woods in the dry down. <br />
Best worn in fall however I could see this being year round. I've definitely recieved compliments on this on how almost boozy and sexy it smelled.<br />
It is a fem leaning fragrance, but I could see this being unisex!<br />
<br />
This is a good daily wear, and does not smell artificial or like chemicals<br />
downside is that it lasted about 4 hrs on me at most, and to be very honest at this price point I expected MUCH better longevity. <br />
<br />
Overall, if it's in your price range I think it's worth a try!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2154110"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2154110#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2153000" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2153000" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sillybobilly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2129377"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2129377.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sillybobilly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Champagne-Apple-Honey-56367.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56367.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Champagne Apple & Honey"title="Champagne Apple & Honey"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2153000ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2153000" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2129377">sillybobilly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-11">05/11/24 15:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I honestly love the artificial cherry smell this perfume has, it smells like the original cherry chapstick or like a generic cherry lollipop. If you want a realistic cherry fragrance this sadly isnt your guy, though even for the fake cherry smell enthusiasts like myself this doesnt last in the slightest. I loved the smell of the fragrance and the worker hosed me down in the stuff. First 20 minutes I left the store I had the test paper that I could smell and she sprayed it on my skin, all was fine and dandy. Come not even 2 hours later and it's gone, I couldnt even smell traces of it. Incredibly disappointing considering the price of this fragrance, I would expect stellar performance at this price tag but this fragrance is anything but that. Other fragrances in the line like tobacco vanille actually last so if youre gonna buy anything from the line let it be one actually worth your money. Nostalgia factor goes crazy on this though</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2153000"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2153000#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2149558" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2148027" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smouhammad452"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2115598"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2115598.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smouhammad452" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2148027ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2148027" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2115598">smouhammad452</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-06">05/06/24 21:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Opening with vibrant cherry, sour candy, and a warm, sweet nuttiness reminiscent of bodacious, this fragrance captivates from the start. As it settles, the same notes persist but with a more subtle presence. Overall, it's a delightful balance of sour and sweet, making it perfect for everyday wear. Among my favorites from the Tom Ford line, I'd rate it 9.5 out of 10!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2148027"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2148027#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2147089" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This legit smells like cherry strepsils. And TF has the utter cheek to charge almost $400 for a bottle of it. GTFOH. Tom Ford is the most overrated house in all of fragrance. I haven't smelled one fragrance of theirs that I actually liked let alone loved. In fact a few have actually made me gag and given me an instant headache (Black Orchid I'm talking to you). The only reason they are popular is due to marketing and people thinking they'll seem cool by buying overpriced crap with a name.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; <br />
I too as a man have worn it and base is truly a special blend. Tom Ford scents have some of the best dry downs and this one does not disappoint. <br />
<br />
If this is what you like you'll love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2137414"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2137414#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2136966" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2131961" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chloepeeters"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2102605"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2102605.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chloepeeters" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2131961ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2131961" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2102605">Chloepeeters</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-21">04/21/24 17:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really love this perfume. Have owned it for a couple of months now. Initially when I spray it it is almost headache inducing and I get a screechy sour cherry note. Within about 10 seconds that goes away and turns into a soft cherry Bakewell scent and projects well for 3 hours MAX on me. Within 4 hours I can't even smell it on my skin I wouldn't say its worth the price point, I have a 100ml bottle and it costs 300! For this price Id expect better silage and longevity. I get better from my 23 Zara dupe (Cherry smoothie). I don't think I would repurchase this based on these factors...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2131961"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2131961#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2131453" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I'm not saying that it smells bad (it's quite good actually), but all these influencers need to chill out when it comes to promoting stuff.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2128257" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gutsnglory"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1986436"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1986436.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gutsnglory" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tiziana-Terenzi/Kirke-32172.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32172.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kirke"title="Kirke"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2128257ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2128257" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1986436">gutsnglory</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-18">04/18/24 05:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>magnificent cherry scent.<br />
when spraying, it is very strong and chemical at first but settles into an enriched cherry juice.<br />
surprisingly makes me smell freshly showered. the floral notes are fresh and not overpowered at all. they really made the cherry liquor scent smell clean (at least on my skin)<br />
also the scent story is interesting and i really like the conceptual work. lost innocence and all.<br />
the downside is its longevity is short.<br />
8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2128257"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2128257#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123876" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2123876" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jumali"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1755805"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jumali" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2123876ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2123876" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1755805">Jumali</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-13">04/13/24 14:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really adore this perfume, but unfortunately, its scent fades too quickly for my liking.<br />
 It's frustrating because I wear perfume for my own enjoyment, not just for others to notice.<br />
 I love how it smells, especially the cherry liquor and marzipan notes, but it seems to dissipate in less than 30 minutes on me. However, others seem to notice it for 3-4 hours. <br />
I'd suggest trying Lovely Cherie from a Saudi Arabian perfumer. It's a great alternative, lasts longer, and is more affordable at around 50 for 100ml. That's actually what I'm wearing now, and it smells just as good as the original. <br />
In my opinion, Tom Ford perfumes are just too overpriced.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2123876"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2123876#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123786" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2123786" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maddieonline"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1719117"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1719117.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maddieonline" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/Vanilla-28-52616.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52616.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla 28"title="Vanilla 28"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2123786ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2123786" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1719117">maddieonline</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-13">04/13/24 13:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have always disliked Tom Ford fragrances and that distinctive Tom Ford DNA. However, today I decided to re-try several and actually quite liked this. It's what it says on the tin - a really strong cherry perfume. I don't get any other notes, not even in the dry down, it is literally cherry through and through. It isn't an amaretto-like cherry but more the vibe of biting into a fresh cherry. The projection and longevity are strong, I don't think I'd purchase a bottle as being around Tom Ford fragrances for too long tends to give me a headache but if you're after a good cherry fragrance this is the one for you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1835755">maolana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-09">04/09/24 21:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When first sprayed, there is a pricking sensation in the nose, indeed this perfume has balsamic notes. The rest only reminds me of Al-Rehab Dalal with a hint of subtle cherry scent. Its performance is somewhat lacking. Not recommended for those who live in tropical or even hotter area, except for indoor wearing only, with AC, of course.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2119913"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2119913#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2119005" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2119005" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Manda88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301563"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1301563.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Manda88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2119005ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2119005" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301563">Manda88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-09">04/09/24 03:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In a sea of cherry fragrances, this one still reigns supreme. But with this price tag, I expect a happy endingor at least more than a two-hour wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2119005"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2119005#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2118975" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2118975" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="civxrlys"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2048151"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2048151.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="civxrlys" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Scandal-Pour-Homme-68074.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68074.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Scandal Pour Homme"title="Scandal Pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2118975ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2118975" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2113667" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Domenica"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882700"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1882700.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Domenica" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2113667ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2113667" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882700">Domenica</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-03">04/03/24 22:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive worn both Lost Cherry and Kayalis Burning Cherry and find them almost identical: sweet, creamy, nutty, marzipany almond scents. If I smell Lost Cherry on my wrist I almost get a fruity note, and theres a woody spice that I couldnt place until I read the comment below about By The Fireplace. I love spice and wish the cinnamon and clove was more prominent. As it is its a pleasant gourmand but nothing special and absolutely not worth the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2113667"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2113667#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2112247" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2112247" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="contristo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2064120"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2064120.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="contristo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Vilhelm-Parfumerie/Dear-Polly-30928.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30928.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dear Polly"title="Dear Polly"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2112247ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2112247" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2064120">contristo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-02">04/02/24 16:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the first time I tried this I thought I was being pranked. Its just cherry extract? I used to use almond and cherry extracts for baking as perfumes as a kid, and this is just that but for hundreds of dollars. Lasted so short on me too. Glad I didnt save up to blind buy the full size like I almost did! Im glad yall love her though, I hope to find my perfect cherry scent one day too</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2112247"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2112247#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2111743" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2111743" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tirafriden"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081522"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2081522.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tirafriden" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2111743ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2111743" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081522">tirafriden</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-02">04/02/24 07:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Best cherry perfume yet, I prefer Lost cherry to other Tom Ford's cherries. Very sweet, deep sugared cherry with almond notes, it is spicy, almost with a hint of cognac and some vanilla-like coat. It lasts long, but it wears perfect - I never get any headaches from it. The only downside is that it is expensive, but I really love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2111743"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2111743#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2111111" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2111111" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jarroditshallbe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1090287"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jarroditshallbe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2111111ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2111111" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1090287">jarroditshallbe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-01">04/01/24 15:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First Spray is a kaboom of straight up hot plump lipped, and a hot cheeked cherry. It radiates warmth from the skin. A touch of grape tart orbits the outer curves. Sugared cinnamon may have been dashed into the concoction but doesn't solidify the texture or add the "dusty" aspect one may correlate to it. It is incredibly dense. The cinnamon is a fleeting endeavor, vanishing as quickly as the innocence of this cherry.<br />
<br />
Cherry in fragrance may be thought of, usually, as an overly fruity, juicy, too youthful note. Something purchased at bath and body works or Rue 21. That is NOT what is here. The effect is almost purposefully lying to you. That inviting innocence doesn't last long. It lured you in with sweet flirting but quickly you are in deeper than you thought.<br />
<br />
Sticking with the name, this "cherry" is not to be lost here, but was quite gone by the time you arrived. It heats up, and doesn't go hyper sweet, and instead veers into a tart cherry being tugged on by the sticky almond note. At the stage is very viscous and sticky, like a trap laid that once it has you, relaxes its grip and lets you swim in its boozy warmth.<br />
<br />
About 15 minutes in, I'm hit by the tonka, and I am all about it. Amaretto and cherries with the richness of tonka. The separation of the notes are more interesting to me here than how they work together. As if the cherry (youthful lust and naivety) is impervious to being pulled down by the heavier notes of the tonka (Sex's emotional ramifications, or you know, just life.)<br />
<br />
I'll continue reaching, so stretch with me. Let's not be naive and act like we know what Tom Ford does with names. Yes its provactive, but it is not called "Losing Cherry" or "Popped Cherry," here it is already gone, but not so far removed from thought. The innocence of its opening speaks to what once was. Its fun, its flirty. It understands its sexiness, knows you are interested, and knows not to give you all its secrets right away. It likes the thought of you lusting after it, and pretends briefly that you are the hunter. Then it spread eagles, I mean swan dives into the lust. You toss a little liquor into the mix of youthful longing (as I imagine happened to most of us) and that cherry is lost.<br />
<br />
The fragrance gets deeper, it get hot breathier? and closer to the skin. it makes me think of too much lip gloss trapped amidst car sex with the windows up. I can imagine getting in this vehicle afterward and thinking "Did Prince fuck in here?" Now, I'm not sure what that means, but I'm still fine with driving the car.<br />
<br />
Relate this to my lack of fragrance experience, but I have nothing else in my Rolodex this smells like. The rose note texture gives you a hint at what's coming with Rose Prick, and the heft and feel of the tonka note puts me in the same space as Chanel Allure Sport Extreme's dry down. BUT, neither of those smell like Lost Cherry, only those small sections, it's just the closest I can get.<br />
<br />
This date started with a cherry vanilla slushie before prom, gets spiked with grenadine and amaretto about halfway through "Best Friends Girl," by The Cars, and ends "spilled" on a fur rug at the after party in your rich friends parents guest room. Yes, this all happens in high school, but like, TV high school where all the actors are mid 20s.<br />
<br />
All that said, I love this fragrance. It is perfectly unisex and all innuendo aside, is lovely from top to bottom. Ok. Still a little innuendo.<br />
<br />
@jarrod_cuthrell on IG</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2111111"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2111111#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2111035" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2111035" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sntiago"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2047146"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2047146.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sntiago" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Ajayeb-Dubai-Portrait-84222.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84222.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ajayeb Dubai Portrait"title="Ajayeb Dubai Portrait"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2111035ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2111035" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2047146">sntiago</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-01">04/01/24 14:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The O.G., the icon, can't do it like her.<br />
I get cherry wine, liquor and cinnamon on a balsamic patchouli base up close(nose pressed against skin). Very sour but in a good way. From a small distance it radiates the fruity plummy-cherry and almond, glued together by a faint rose. It all lays on a very bitter/woody/balsamic/earthy - tldr heavy spicy base. It reads very mature. This perfume started my fragrance journey.<br />
It's a very complex scents and changes beautifully throughout the entire hour and a half that it lasts. <br />
It's clearly unisex and not sweet despite the fruits and vanilla. <br />
<br />
The Kayali Lovefest dupe, the most popular one locally, is a lot younger, juicier and sweeter. There's none of that heavy complex base. But - it radiates the same fruity cherry almond scent from afar. <br />
<br />
I love this perfume for its spicy cherry and booze and sexyness, but I think its too mature for me. Its made for a very sexy 40-something woman and sits close to skin as to not offend anyone during business meetings and to not catch the attention of any men in the bar she's sitting in with her girlfriends, celebrating her divorce from her useless husband - she's had enough of men. I'll finish my bottle and maybe I'll come back to it one day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2111035"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2111035#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2108221" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2108221" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Guitar 2016"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1219929"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1219929.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Guitar 2016" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Gentleman-Eau-de-Parfum-Boisee-59009.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59009.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gentleman Eau de Parfum Boise"title="Gentleman Eau de Parfum Boise"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2108221ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2108221" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1219929">Guitar 2016</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 15:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is a Great Fragrance ! Modern, Elegant, Classy, luxurious, Sweet, Spicy and Unique. I bought it blind-buy as a Gift for my wife after I read positive comments and l watched reviews on YouTube. In my opinion, Lost Cherry is more Feminine and suitable for Women. It opens up with sweet cherry, bitter almond, floral and fruity notes in the background then dry down is sweet warm spicy, balsamic, vanilla and woody. It smells similar to cherry liqueur chocolate. My wife loves it, she told me, This is very pleasant and Unique scent. Longevity is good. <br />
Highly Recommended. <br />
Thumbs Up. <br />
Rating  : 8 / 10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2108221"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2108221#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2107658" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2107658" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fresh Garbage"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2076236"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2076236.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fresh Garbage" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2107658ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2107658" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2076236">Fresh Garbage</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 02:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Overpriced but overall definitely a killer scent.<br />
I payed $250 for an 80ml bottle and I dont regret it one bit. Ive heard Oakcha has a good dupe (but Im not 100% sure thats true). <br />
Im a 19 yr old boy and usually lean towards more masculine scents, but wear it on my lazy days when Im feeling down or tired. Its a very comforting scent that reminds you of winter, turning any memory youre reminiscing on while wearing it grey and pallid blue. It might be just me but it kinda feels like a hug from my mom, very cozy, motherly, and nostalgic. Im a little embarrassed to admit it, but I spray it on my pillows before I go to bed just for the comforting factor. <br />
It has a classic sweet perfume-ey smell, but an undeniable unique factor that comes from the cherry and bitter almond notes. Bitter almond is mostly what I pick up on when wearing this.<br />
Longevity sucks ass tbh (Ive noticed it lasts longer on clothes) but the silage is OK, could be better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2107658"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2107658#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2106721" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
