align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2106721"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2106721#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2106666" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2106666" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Isabella Therese"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1337526"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1337526.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Isabella Therese" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Houbigant/Ambre-Rubis-97383.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.97383.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ambre Rubis"title="Ambre Rubis"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2106666ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2106666" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1337526">Isabella Therese</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-28">03/28/24 03:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The medicine comments have to be an American thing. We don't have any medicines in my country that smell or taste like cherries, so I don't get any medicinal vibes from this fragrance. Lost Cherry is a juicy, rich, boozy, sweet cherry liqueur with a woody vanilla base and a litte bit of almond in the background. It's so intoxicating and sexy. Makes me feel amazing. Definitely leans feminine to my nose. The longevity is not the best but also not the worst. It lasts about 6 hours on my skin, which I don't mind since I only wear it for date nights and don't need 12+ hours of longevity. It projects really well too. Lost Cherry is the queen of sexy fragrances in my humble opinion. 10/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2106666"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2106666#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2105923" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2105923" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="shohruhnorqulov08"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1956778"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1956778.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="shohruhnorqulov08" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2105923ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2105923" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1956778">shohruhnorqulov08</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-27">03/27/24 10:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very very sweet perfume. When we were kids, we hung scented paper in the car. This is the same smell. My sisters really liked it. Women appreciate this perfume more.<br />
<br />
7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2105923"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2105923#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2105865" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2105865" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gordon_Fragrance"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074159"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gordon_Fragrance" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2105865ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2105865" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074159">Gordon_Fragrance</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-27">03/27/24 09:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beauiful scent no question. However the sillage is not there, doesnt last very long, and I ran out of my 35ml quite soon.<br />
I tried other cherry related scents, not going to advertise anything, but I have to say this is roughly underperforming.<br />
Please take my words with a grain of salt, as I am accustomed to powerful, high performing scents, in the same price region, albeit this one let me down badly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2105865"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2105865#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2105740" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2105740" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Letmeregister"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1920970"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1920970.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Letmeregister" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2105740ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2105740" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1920970">Letmeregister</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-27">03/27/24 07:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The prettiest cherry perfume Imo, it's hard to find a cherry perfume that is realistic and doesn't smell like candy. However, what bothers me is that the scent fades pretty quickly on me to a smokey and spicy scent, really not flattering. To maintain the cherry and almond scent I would need to reapply pretty often. I don't think the price is justifiable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2105740"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2105740#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2102860" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2102860" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ellafragrance"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1927364"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1927364.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ellafragrance" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Alhambra/Delilah-90273.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90273.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delilah"title="Delilah"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2102860ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2102860" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1927364">ellafragrance</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-24">03/24/24 13:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's so hyped on social media. "It's the only cherry scent that doesn't smell like medicine!" "The best cherry scent out there!" "Smells like a rockstars girlfriend!!!" <br />
<br />
I had high hopes... But it smells like medicine. I was so excited to smell something so hyped but I cannot stand it. Not for my nose, but my friend liked it. Definitely one you NEED to smell and DO NOT BLIND BUY.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2102860"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2102860#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2102653" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2102653" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lbustos2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2055934"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2055934.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lbustos2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Princess-90174.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90174.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Princess"title="Princess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2102653ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2102653" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2055934">Lbustos2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-24">03/24/24 09:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is pretty simple: it's a cherry almond fragrance. However, it's a scent that definitely transcends throughout the day. The smell unravels as the day goes on. I am a cherry lover and I prefer a sweet, more synthetic-like cherry smell, rather than a deep smoky cherry. That being said, this perfume has been, and always will be perfection. It is not very complex at all, although the scent does develop throughout the day. Upon first spray, you'll smell a nutty cherry. It almost smells like artificial cherry, but it's so yummy, ripe, and juicy. It smells like a juicy maraschino cherry. Then, it turns into an amaretto cherry kind of smell. I get a sense of a boozy, cherry, bitter almond kind of smell. It smells like a dark, black cherry. After, in its final stage, it smells more like a Jergens cherry almond scent. It almost smells kind of soapy and clean. As a cherry lover, I'm glad I get to experience different cherry worlds with this fragrance. It has a steeper price tag, but I don't mind, as I genuinely appreciate a non offensive, sweet, deep, and juicy cherry smell. Can't go wrong with Lost Cherry. She's an OG.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2102653"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2102653#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2101652" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Cinnamon comes through too</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2098174"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2098174#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2098006" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2097332" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="torquemadaxiii"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1182469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1182469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="torquemadaxiii" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51411.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lost Cherry"title="Lost Cherry"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2097332ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2097332" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1182469">torquemadaxiii</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-19">03/19/24 09:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Strange how skin alchemy works. On first spray I get a very realistic cherry, juicy, rich, with some liquor. When time passes however, cherry really becomes lost - it is barely audible on the background, and the fragrance turns very smoky, as if cherries were roasted.) And on my skin it mightily reminds By The Fireplace. Maybe it is due to Peru balsam, which is present in both fragrances. I quite like Lost Cherry but I would have liked if cherries remained more prominent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2097332"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2097332#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2095918" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2095918" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Glyksburg"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1941890"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1941890.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Glyksburg" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2095918ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2095918" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1941890">Glyksburg</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-18">03/18/24 01:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I fully agree with @morose, it's the best description I've ever heard about Lost Cherry - "smells like Cherry flavoured Dr Pepper". I bougth 5ml for my sister as a gift,  and I wanna say, that I feel utterly impressed by the fact how sexy, attractive and unique this Tom Ford fragrance, I harshly expected typical for teenager parfume, that is just sweet&amp;dumb as composition. Not recommended for blind buy, if you wanna something like Lost Cherry but much more unique and less used - try Tom Ford Bitter Peach. <br />
Im a guy, so the best way to describe how much I like this smell is next words: this is so sweet, sour and sexy aura, that I would like to eat the person who wears this one, this is amathingly arousing smell. <br />
<br />
P.S <br />
In my Opinion - for you, much better buy 3 niche feminine fragrances instead of 1 lost cherry bottle, but if you have urge and money, than go for It.<br />
 (I don't like using word "sexy" but this smell is way too sexy to omit the right definitions)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2095918"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2095918#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2094677" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2080803" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Wulfvynn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2023965"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2023965.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Wulfvynn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2080803ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2080803" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2023965">Wulfvynn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-03">03/03/24 07:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wanted to try this one as everyone on tiktok was raving about it, some even said it smells like cadavers, which peaked my interest even more. So I did try it and to say I was dissapointed is an understatement. Having grown up in a slavic country where we make liquor out of literally anything, this reminded me of a cheap cherry liquor and that one time I got so drunk I regretted it the whole month. I tried it on skin and waited few hours hoping the liquor smell would go away but it didnt. I even asked my mother who used to work with cadavers if it smelled like one, it didnt. Formaldehyde, which is used to preserve cadavers, is supposed to smell like bitter almonds, yes, but not like this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2080803"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2080803#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2080791" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2080791" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Honeysuckle85"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1196267"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1196267.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Honeysuckle85" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2080791ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2080791" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1196267">Honeysuckle85</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-03">03/03/24 06:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lost Cherry is my most favourite perfume ever. I have many and Ive tried many, I could easily live without the majority of the perfumes I have, but couldnt live without Lost Cherry.. I guess It works wonders on my skin as it opens up with a beautiful sweet and boozy cherry, as soon as the fragrance develops rose, plum note, jasmine and sweet notes come along and the blend is absolute perfection. It projects a lot during the first hours and it stays close to the skin during the rest of the day. I can smell on clothes for weeks and in my hair until the next shampoo. I know a lot of people complain with the longevity of this fragrance, it is so weird to me as I find it incredibly long lasting but light at the same time, it melts in your skin without covering your natural scent, this is why is so intriguing, sexy and beautiful. Ive never received so many compliments wearing a fragrance (and being chased by someone willing to eat me alive )</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2080791"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2080791#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2080518" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2080518" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WildCalifornia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036447"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="WildCalifornia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2080518ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2080518" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036447">WildCalifornia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-02">03/02/24 21:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This to me was love at first smell. I smelled the electric cherry first which made me melt but it's just too feminine. The smoke cherry isn't bad but it's too smokey and didn't have the brightness and sweetness I wanted . Then I finally tried this and it almost made my eyes roll back haha. I like the brighter electric cherry but this is way more unisex. In a nutshell you get the strong cherry skin scent that gets a little cherry flesh splash and a little almond undertone. Then you get the plum and slight jasmine come in before the is settles with the spice and woods. But it all comes together in a smooth wood tonka cinnamon base. 2 big issues with the fragrance. The first is the price . It's so dang expensive. Second is the longevity. If this really lasted and had good sillage it would probably be worth it . But it doesn't last. The first 45 minutes are just magic . Next 30 it mellows but is there. After about 2 hours you smell it on the skin but it has less than a foot of sillage. By the 4th hour you have to dig your nose into your skin to smell it. This is with 2 sprays per forearm/wrist, one neck and one chest . Which is more than I usually use. I have tried dupes but none come close to the scent .<br />
Scent- 10.0<br />
Complexity - 7.5<br />
Quality - 10.0<br />
Performance - 7.0<br />
Bottle - 9.0</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2080518"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2080518#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2079468" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2079468" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alexgautonomy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2037790"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2037790.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alexgautonomy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2079468ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2079468" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2037790">alexgautonomy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-01">03/01/24 19:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>like a sour amaretto paired with a maraschino cherry and a cig. love love love</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2079468"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2079468#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2078227" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2078227" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scent_Alchemist"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2038694"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scent_Alchemist" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2078227ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2078227" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2038694">Scent_Alchemist</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-29">02/29/24 15:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As a long-time proponent of layering fragrances to create a more custom scent, I've found TF Lost Cherry to be a wonderful tool in my arsenal. While it appears rather one-dimensional and a bit juvenile on its own, when layered with TF Oud Wood, it becomes my signature cool weather scent.  The Oud does a lovely job of "ripening" the more unrefined fruity notes and bringing about a more luscious, dark, smoky cherry. The Lost Cherry breathes a bit of youthfulness into the Oud, which, on its own can be rather dowdy/flat. <br />
If you find yourself in possession of some Lost Cherry that you feel is a bit too punchy for your taste, I encourage you to try layering it with something a bit darker. Maybe even smoky. You might be surprised.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2078227"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2078227#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2077880" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2077880" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mynosemynose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2010799"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2010799.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mynosemynose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2077880ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2077880" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2010799">mynosemynose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-29">02/29/24 08:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I cant see myself ever splashing out on it, but I really do love this. Its yummy and sweet, and when I first tried it I found it had this kind of plasticky quality that I really adore (entertaining and appealing synthetic aura, a certain solid shininess) It felt like eating a boozy cherry pudding out of a plastic bowl on a plastic tablecloth, at night with very few lights on in the house. The moon is in the window. Theres a presence of low tobacco, which as they say pushes it into the masculine (bad news for the divine feminine girlhood girlies). Comparing it to my (fine but just not the same) Essence Vault dupe, you can really sense the sharp lovely alcohol, and the lowness. Unfortunately, expensive perfumes often smell expensive.<br />
<br />
(Edit: Also a side note for my own pleasure/reference: i think its fun that benzaldehyde (the almond smell, found in both almonds and cherries) is also used as an embalming deodorant. However the same can be said of any random cherry perfume. Lost Cherry is for an /expensive/ plastic-wrapped glamour corpse)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2077880"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2077880#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2074466" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2074466" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Arion"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1468813"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1468813.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Arion" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Saharienne-32270.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32270.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Saharienne"title="Saharienne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2074466ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2074466" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1468813">Arion</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-26">02/26/24 05:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I do not want to sound mean. Im not crazy about sweet perfumes but ocasionally do own a couple. This reminds me of vape or a bathroom freshner. I paid so much for it and i was so disappointed. Please note this is my personal opinion im not hating on anyone who loves this scent</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2074466"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2074466#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2072314" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2072314" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="annijakk26"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2030550"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2030550.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="annijakk26" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2072314ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2072314" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2030550">annijakk26</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-24">02/24/24 02:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is so me, iam in love</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2072314"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2072314#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2070525" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2070525" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cheleine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349744"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1349744.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cheleine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Toilette-9241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2070525ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2070525" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349744">cheleine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-22">02/22/24 10:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Coming back to this scent after almost 3 years.<br />
The reason is I tried Electric Cherry and came laughing back to this to remember what a real cherry perfume should smell like*drums*. Lost Cherry it is!<br />
This has an elegant scent profile and a deep cherry note that to me doesnt smell medicinal or like cough drops.<br />
Its natural, its balmy, its sexy, slightly dark, perfectly unisex and just sweet enough to intoxicate you. <br />
If Electric Cherry is an annoying tiktok teenager that tries too hard to fit in, then Lost Cherry is its older femme fatale sibling that naturally stands out and is effortlessly hot &amp; seductive without really trying or caring. <br />
Performance wise, this is a TF creation that respects the money you put into its purchase. A good investment.<br />
The newer cherry offering is laughable and people who know their Tom Fords will agree that the brand is currently not doing well with its new releases.<br />
Lost Cherry remains one of its bestsellers for a reason.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2070525"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2070525#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2070399" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2027308">SophiesAnologS9713</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-22">02/22/24 08:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this scent its such a light fun scent but not childish its still very elegant and reformed.  I specifically love that it smells pretty similar to embalming fluid and not in a bad way its very enjoyable and sweet.  (I work in mortuary/medical so I'm familiar with the smell).  This is the scent for you if you want something sweet light and playful but you have a more darker serious vibe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2070399"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2070399#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2068416" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2068416" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JKanyce"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1861173"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="JKanyce" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2068416ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2068416" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1861173">JKanyce</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-20">02/20/24 11:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cherry cough syrup on the opening. My son and I both had an "oh hell no" moment upon our initial sniff. It was so bad, we wondered how ANYONE could enjoy it. However, while it's not for me, I could understand why someone might like the dry down on this. It smells like cherry almond extract if there were such a thing. It's TOO gourmand.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="2068416"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=2068416#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="51411" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
