padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1506554" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="charlotte_twister"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1447769"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1447769.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="charlotte_twister" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lolita-Lempicka/Lolita-Lempicka-456.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.456.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lolita Lempicka"title="Lolita Lempicka"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1506554ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1506554" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1447769">charlotte_twister</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-17">02/17/22 18:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is insane. Poison, medicine, resin lacquer lollipop. Full on anime hospital fantasy, weird, gory romance. I'm in lust for the cough syrup element in perfume. I'm dumb for Lost Cherry.<br />
<br />
As for imagery - think those red lollies with the scorpions inside. Dentistry fetish. 1996 Crash and 2002 Secretary. Syringe jello shots and gummy larvae (worms are too pass for the honor). Your nerdy office crush in a sexy nurse outfit, unexpected.<br />
<br />
This layered with a whiter maybe even more acidic base (for performance sake) will be my holy grail for nights of cold cold wind.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="1506554"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=1506554#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent983499" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc983499" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="happy-knight"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1085545"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1085545.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="happy-knight" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma983499ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd983499" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1085545">happy-knight</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-09-19">09/19/18 23:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Can I just read like- actual reviews for this scent instead of people complaining about the price,pretentiousness, or name of this Tom Ford perfume? That would be really cool.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="983499"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=983499#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1493493" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1493493" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pineneedle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1413838"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1413838.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pineneedle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lys 41"title="Lys 41"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1493493ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1493493" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1413838">pineneedle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-29">01/29/22 08:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I recently marched myself (pale, mushroom-like, undersocialised) to my local old rich lady department store and to my delight was able to sample Lost Cherry. Reader, I was shocked by how much my social skills had disintegrated since the onset of lockdown (I kept reciting fragrance factoids at the poor woman working the Tom Ford section) and delighted I tell you, absolutely delighted by this cherry-pie-and-cough-syrup scent. <br />
<br />
It starts out like a wonderful hybrid between cherry pie and a Bakewell tart - Twin Peaks meets the Great British Bake Off - and then somehow moves straight to synthetic, medicinal cherry. I adored it. However, the rumours are true; the longevity is less than ideal. I also got some weird fishy amines at around hour 3, but they subsided quickly. <br />
<br />
Wear this while you poison your third husband with cyanide - it will mask the scent, and wears off quickly enough that the police won't be able to track you via sillage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="1493493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=1493493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1334033" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1334033" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gobtholemew"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1299977"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1299977.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gobtholemew" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Karma-4367.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4367.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Karma"title="Karma"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1334033ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1334033" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1299977">Gobtholemew</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-28">04/28/21 16:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dont get me wrong, I love this scent. But no perfume will ever be worth $350 unless it makes my celebrity crush of the month magically appear when its sprayed. <br />
<br />
This isnt a candy-like cherry, or the kind you smell in cherry soda. This is real, fresh cherry. Its perfect and I want to drink it. But Tom Ford can get lost if he thinks its worth over $300. Maybe Im too anti-capitalist for this hobby.<br />
<br />
Oh and also this lasts like 3 hours maximum. Sure, you can reapply, but at this price point? Its a yikes from me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="1334033"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=1334033#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1112925" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1112925" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MrBolton"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1161847"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1161847.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MrBolton" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Chinotto-di-Liguria-48940.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48940.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chinotto di Liguria"title="Chinotto di Liguria"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1112925ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1112925" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1161847">MrBolton</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-05">11/05/19 17:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I finally got a sample of this after having mixed results smelling it in stores on the rare occasion Im near a TF boutique/counter. Im floored! I think this is now my favorite fragrance to date, and Ive smelled/owned a lot. I think I could literally have it as a one scent collection if I had tomy grail. Its seriously so delicious and easily a compliment getter, which Ive already gotten one unsolicited compliment on it. <br />
<br />
At first, the dry down was a little like Tom Ford Vanille Fatale, which I also own. Its like they took that scent and made it more gourmand and crowd-pleasing. Theyre not entirely redundant, but worth mentioning the similarity. Its definitely got that Tom Ford signature DNA. I dont know what it is, but theres a common denominator in a lot of TF fragrances. <br />
<br />
The cherry that it starts with is at 100, and then dials down to maybe 10 by the end of its life. That incredible cherry lasts about 20 minutes to an hour. Then theres this almond and vanilla that play so well. Those notes can smell cheap sometimes, but theyre exquisitely executed here. <br />
<br />
Its middle of the road unisex. Im a man, and I have no shame wearing it. Id wear this with a suit to anything confidently. Maybe not an interview (Clive Christian Rock Rose or 1872 for that), but anything else! This has date night written all over it, too. Ill also wear it in jeans. Its just a great all-rounder.<br />
<br />
Seasonally, its probably best suited for cooler weather, but Ill have this on year-round. Its got a crispness to it that will work in Spring/Summer. Mississippi Summers are blazing, though, so Ill probably reach for my former favorite Tom Ford, Venetian Bergamot.<br />
<br />
My wearing is limited, but 12 hours later its still detectable about 3 inches from the skin. It performs best through the first 5 hours or so. Could be a little better performance for the projection phase, but Im almost giving it a pass due to having a masterpiece scent.<br />
<br />
I got my 100 mL bottle on the way. Got it discounted, but it may be worth full price. A lot more unique than Aventus nowadays, and this can probably garner more compliments. I always judge a fragrance against Aventus, even if theyre nowhere similar. <br />
<br />
10.5/10 masterpiece scent. 8/10 projection/sillage. 8.5/10 longevity (wish the cherry note would last a little longer. Even still its great). Full bottle worthy!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="1112925"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=1112925#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="51411" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1360454" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1360454" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="VictoriaSmells"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1346829"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1346829.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="VictoriaSmells" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1360454ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1360454" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1346829">VictoriaSmells</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-15">06/15/21 13:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My husband and I smelled this on paper strips at the mall. Would it smell any different on warm skin? Maybe.<br />
But I'm not willing to find out because no matter how many times I've tried to appreciate Tom Ford, I'm always disappointed.<br />
<br />
Having worked in a liquor warehouse for several years, I am VERY familiar with cherry liqueurs, amarettos and the like. But the opening of this, at BEST, is a cherry coke with a bottom shelf spiced rum.<br />
In reality, it was less boozy and more medicinal, AKA cherry cough syrup.<br />
In fact, I think I even smell a Robitussin bottle- as someone mentioned below "a plastic licorice smell" yes, agreed.<br />
<br />
We sat there waiting for it to turn into something more - whatever it is that draws so much hype - but it just turned into an unpleasant, throat-drying experience that reminded me of 'Big Red' chewing gum.<br />
<br />
Disappointed is an understatement.<br />
TF's egregious prices adding insult to injury is what always bumps my reviews from just "meh" to "omg i hate this with the burning intensity of a thousand desert suns, how is this justified?"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="1360454"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=1360454#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1022166" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1022166" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="virga"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/49549"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="virga" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1022166ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1022166" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/49549">virga</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-19">01/19/19 04:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lost Cherry is spicy sweet cherry unisex scent. Thats it. Nicely done, but not daring neither innovative. Boring even. If Lost Cherry costed 50 euros for a bottle I would said its worth to try. But it costs almost 300 and is definitely not worth the money.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="1022166"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=1022166#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent987497" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc987497" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Spicey Pickled Ginger"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089825"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1089825.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Spicey Pickled Ginger" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma987497ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd987497" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089825">Spicey Pickled Ginger</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-02">10/02/18 18:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>**SPOILER ALERT**<br />
<br />
I AM the one person you know that will walk into Bath &amp; Body, and sniff EVERYTHING. Every candle and room spray at Bed/Bath/Beyond gets shoved under my nose. I can't help it. I can't stand celeb/COTY/Avon, and yet still smell them. I. Cannot. Help. It. <br />
<br />
So I broke down and whiffed a wuff of Lost Cherry. ............<br />
<br />
I just want to say that I wish I'd have never read the previous review that said it smelled like cherry Dr Pepper, because - yeah. <br />
<br />
But it was Cherry Dr Pepper in a McD's cup - the one coated with wax to keep it from leaking - annnnd you smell the waxy cardboardiness of the cup and drink all right there under your nose.<br />
<br />
I'm not saying I hated it or even disliked it. I don't know if I could purposefully spritz myself to smell like that though......<br />
<br />
Or think SONIC - they'll mix the cherry into your Dr P, but the cup smell isn't the same.<br />
<br />
Sorry. :/<br />
<br />
#"@$%#**!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="987497"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=987497#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1061970" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1061970" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JaneBluff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/730865"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.730865.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JaneBluff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Elixir-Charnel-Gourmand-Coquin-4675.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4675.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elixir Charnel Gourmand Coquin"title="Elixir Charnel Gourmand Coquin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1061970ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1061970" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/730865">JaneBluff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-19">05/19/19 08:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Is this called Lost Cherry because the cherry is gone after only a few minutes? <br />
<br />
I had no real expectations of this since I already found my favorite cherry scents but I ended up with a sample of this and gave it a couple days of wear. <br />
<br />
The initial spray is a nice syrupy cherry, a bit darker than a maraschino with a hint of something balsamic. <br />
<br />
After two or three minutes the cherry fades down and the cinnamon and tonka move to the forefront. <br />
<br />
At this point I can't sense any cherry and i'm left with a slightly resinous, sweet and spicy skin scent that somewhat reminds me of the spiced drydown of Gourmand Coquin (not the same by any means) but way less edible and slightly varnish like. <br />
<br />
I don't think this is a very interesting or innovative release and the quality and performance don't warrant the high price tag in my opinion. <br />
<br />
That being said, I did enjoy testing it out and found it to be fairly pleasant but it's one I would avoid blind buying if you are on the hunt for a good cherry.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="1061970"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=1061970#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1038146" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1038146" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maja2812"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19315"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.19315.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maja2812" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bvlgari/BLV-Eau-de-Parfum-II-6481.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6481.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="BLV Eau de Parfum II"title="BLV Eau de Parfum II"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1038146ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1038146" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19315">Maja2812</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-05">03/05/19 18:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't understand this Tom Ford fragrance and all the hype in the comments below. This has to be the worst of the collection to date. It smells cheap! It reminds me of those knockoff, dupe perfumes sold in "hoochie mama" clothing stores  la "Rainbow" or "G+G" back-in-the-day. I suppose I'm hinting at trashy. I got to smell it today; wasn't particularly looking for it, but, there it finally was, in stock after 2 months of searching. Eager to test what the hype was about, it went on my wrists and neck smelling like a bankteller window's cHeAp cherry lollipop; very strong, synthetic, corn syrupy, bordering on a "Little Tree" air freshener...sickening. My impression was: "this smells like something a kid would like!". Hours later, it became a metallic, damn-near smoky, candyish mess. I reeked like a woman who smokes and masks the stench with too sweet, sickly cloying, stale perfume. I couldn't wait to shower and will have to do laundry sooner. I visualize Cardi B or Nicki Minaj promoting this or wearing it...not his typical sophisticated fragrance at all. Perhaps that's why he monikered it " Lost Cherry"...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51411"comment_id="1038146"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html?ccid=1038146#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="51411" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="51411":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="51411" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300 __728x90" id="fragranticacom_perfume_footer" v-pre>
</div></div></div>

            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.de").replace(/designers/, "Designer").replace(/perfume/, "Parfum") });
                if (lang == 'ES') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.es").replace(/designers/, "disenador") });
                if (lang == 'FR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.fr").replace(/designers/, "designer").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });

                if (lang == 'IT') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.it").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'RU') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ru") });
                if (lang == 'PL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.pl").replace(/designers/, "marki").replace(/perfume/, "perfumy") });
                if (lang == 'PT') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.com.br").replace(/designers/, "desenhista") });
                if (lang == 'EL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.gr").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'ZH') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.asia").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'NL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.nl").replace(/designers/, "ontwerper").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });

            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.punmiris.com").replace(/designers/, "dizajner").replace(/perfume/, "parfem") });

            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ro").replace(/designers/, "creatori").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });

                if (lang == 'UK') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ua").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'MN') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {

            });
</script>


<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#fragranticaloader').fadeOut(20);
    });
</script>
</body>
</html>
